poem:
Title: "Ulster's Ode"

In Belfast's grandest hall,
past echoes of Dickens' tales,
dance and boxing brawl –
voices opposed, in fervor thrust,
as symphonic strains hold sway,
linking a stormy, noble past,
with Ulster's present day.
Charles, Ian, Zeppelin's ghost –
whispers in the music's host,
In harmony and discord lie,
the tales of days gone by.
